topic.name: Event
topic.documentation: a meeting of researchers at a specific time and place
topic.wikiDocumentation: a meeting of researchers at a specific time and place (virtual or physical) and with a specific thematic focus to present, hear and discuss research outputs

properties.name: acronym
properties.label: acronym
properties.documentation: This property is of the datatype Text and it is being used to provide the '''acronym''' of an academic event or an event series.It is a recommended property when describing an academic event or event series and it is not needed for the DOI registration process via DataCite.

properties.name: dblpConferenceId
properties.label: dblp Conference ID
properties.documentation:
This property  of the datatype External identifier is used to provide the identifier with which an entity is indexed in [https://dblp2.uni-trier.de/ dblp]. Its external formatter URI is https://dblp2.uni-trier.de/db/conf/$1.
In Open Research it is mostly used to identify an academic event within dblp. 
The use of this property is optional. It is not necessary for the DOI registration process via DataCite.

properties.name: endDate
properties.label: end date
properties.documentation:
This property is of the datatype Date and it is being used to provide the '''end date''' of an academic event or a project.
This property is aligned with icaltzd:dtend.
It is a mandatory property when describing an academic event and it is needed for the DOI registration process via DataCite.

properties.name: inEventSeries
properties.label: in event series
properties.documentation: The property '''Event in series''', of the datatype Page, is used to state that an academic event is part of a specific academic event series. Although this property is not needed for the DOI registration process via DataCite its usage is strongly recommended.

properties.name: eventType
properties.label: event type
properties.allowedValues: congress, conference, workshop, seminar, colloquium, tutorial, track, symposium, hackathon, meet-up, session, demonstration, other
properties.documentation: This property  of the datatype Text is used to specify the format of an academic event. The use of this property is recommended. It is necessary for the DOI registration process via DataCite.

properties.name: eventTypeOther
properties.label: event type other
properties.documentation:
This property  of the datatype Text is needed to further specify the format of an academic event if this format is not among the allowed values of [[Property:Event_type]] and thus "other" was chosen.
The use of this property is recommended.
It is necessary for the DOI registration process via DataCite.

properties.name: gndId
properties.label: GND ID
properties.documentation:
This property  of the datatype External identifier is used to provide the identifier with which an entity is indexed in the [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Integrated_Authority_File Integrated_Authority_File (GND)]. Its external formatter URI is http://d-nb.info/gnd/$1.
In Open Research it is mostly used to identify an academic event or event series within the GND. 
The use of this property is optional.
It is not necessary for the DOI registration process via DataCite.

properties.name: city
properties.label: City
properties.documentation:
The property '''Has location city''' can be used to specify the city where a street, building, [[Concept:Event|event]], etc. is located in.
It is of the datatype Page and a special case of the Property:Located in. Other properties for specifying locations are: [[property:Has location country]], [[property:Has location state]] and [[property:Has location address]].
When specifying the city in which an academic event takes or took place, using this property is not needed for the DOI registration process via DataCite but strongly recommended.

properties.name: country
properties.label: Country
properties.documentation:
The property  '''Has location country''' is used to describe the country where something is located in.
It is of the datatype Page and a special case of the Property:Located in. Other properties for specifying locations are: [[property:Has location city]], [[property:Has location state]] and [[property:Has location address]].
When specifying the country in which an academic event takes or took place, using this property is not needed for the DOI registration process via DataCite but strongly recommended.

properties.name: subject
properties.label: academic field/subject
properties.documentation:
The '''academic field''' property is used to denote the research area of an academic event or event series. The allowed values of this property should be derived from a controlled vocabulary such as the OECD or DFG classification scheme.
Although this property is not needed for the DOI registration process via DataCite its usage is strongly recommended.

properties.name: Homepage
properties.label: official website
properties.documentation:
This property is of the datatype URL and it is being used to provide the '''official website''' of an academic event or an event series.
It is a recommended property when describing an academic event or event series and it is not needed for the DOI registration process via DataCite.

properties.name: meetingUrl
properties.label: meeting URL
properties.documentation: This property is being used to provide the '''meeting URL''' for the virtual location of an academic, which the participants need to take part in in case of an online or hybrid event. It is a recommended property when describing an academic event and it is not needed for the DOI registration process via DataCite.

properties.name: ordinal
properties.label: event number
properties.documentation: This property  of the datatype Number represents the ordinal number of an event within an event series. Thereby it informs about the age of an event series. This property is not needed for the DOI registration process via DataCite and is optional.

properties.name: sponsor
properties.label: sponsor
properties.documentation:
This property  of the datatype Page is used to specify the organization or person that sponsors or funds an academic event or event series. 
The use of this property is recommended. It is not necessary for the DOI registration process via DataCite.

properties.name: startDate
properties.label: start date
properties.documentation:
This property is of the datatype Date and it is being used to provide the '''start date''' of an academic event or a project.
This property is aligned with icaltzd:dtstart. It is a mandatory property when describing an academic event and it is needed for the DOI registration process via DataCite.

properties.name: name
properties.label: official name
properties.documentation:
This property  is of the datatype Text and it is being used to specify the '''official name''' of an academic event or event series. 
It is a mandatory property when describing an academic event or event series and it is needed for the DOI registration process via DataCite.

properties.name: wikicfpId
properties.label: wikiCFP ID
properties.documentation:
This property  of the datatype External identifier is used to provide the identifier with which an entity is indexed in [http://www.wikicfp.com WikiCFP]. Its external formatter URI is http://www.wikicfp.com/cfp/servlet/event.showcfp?eventid=$1.
In Open Research it is used to identify an academic event or event series within WikiCFP. 
The use of this property is optional. It is not necessary for the DOI registration process via DataCite.

properties.name: wikidataId
properties.label: wikidata QID
properties.documentation:
This property  of the datatype External identifier is used to provide the identifier with which an entity is indexed in [https://www.wikidata.org/wiki/Wikidata:Main_Page Wikidata]. Its external formatter URI is https://www.wikidata.org/entity/$1.
In Open Research it is mostly used to identify an academic event or event series within Wikidata. 
The use of this property is optional. It is not necessary for the DOI registration process via DataCite.
